intro: Silene danielii, commonly known as Daniel's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Alps. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in rocky and alpine meadows, where it is adapted to cold and harsh environmental conditions. Silene danielii is a rare species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
